page.title: 17EAMONT BRIDGE
page.content: A hamlet 1.5m S of Penrith where the A6 crosses the River Eamont by a single-track 3 arched sandstone bridge once the Cumberland/Westmorland boundary, before climbing Kemplay Bank northwards to the town. A mixture of vernacular and classic style buildings from 18th C.to modern, displaying different materials and techniques. Most buildings flank the A6, a less busy northern route since M6 was built and used mainly by local and tourist traffic. Fewer buildings spread at right angles along the river towards the former mill. There is a P.O. an inn, an hotel, a joiners, an office, a repair garage, a chicken farm and a small hauliers. In the vicinity is a henge monument, remains of an impressive castellated hall with a preserved C of E chapel adjacent.
